results.definition: weak and likely to lose consciousness
examples: suddenly felt faint from the pain
was sick and faint from hunger

results.definition: deficient in magnitude; barely perceptible; lacking clarity or brightness or loudness etc
examples: the wan sun cast faint shadows
the faint light of a distant candle

results.definition: lacking conviction or boldness or courage
examples: faint heart ne'er won fair lady

results.definition: pass out from weakness, physical or emotional distress due to a loss of blood supply to the brain
a spontaneous loss of consciousness caused by insufficient blood to the brain
indistinctly understood or felt or perceived
examples: a faint clue to the origin of the mystery
